meanings.definition: The quality or state of being repellent.
meanings.sent1: The repellencies of the strong-smelling spray kept the bugs away.
meanings.sent2: The repellencies of the skunk's odor made everyone run in the opposite direction.
meanings.sent3: The repellencies of the sour candy made the kids pucker their lips in distaste.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp tone had the repellencies of a stern teacher scolding her students.
meanings.sent5: The repellencies of the bitter medicine lingered in his mouth long after he swallowed it.

meanings.definition: The ability to repel or drive away.
meanings.sent1: The repellencies of the scarecrow kept the birds from landing on the crops.
meanings.sent2: The repellencies of the strong wind pushed the sailboat away from the shore.
meanings.sent3: The repellencies of the loud noise made the cat dart under the bed in fear.
meanings.sent4: The repellencies of her icy stare made him feel unwelcome in the room.
meanings.sent5: The repellencies of the bright light made the moths flutter in the opposite direction.
